root.name: string

example.code: str1 = 'CCCP' data = ['C', 'C', 'C', 'P'] str2 = "".join(data) # Join elements of data into one string. println(str1) # Prints 'CCCP' println(str2) # Prints 'CCCP'

root.description:
A string is a sequence of characters. Python's built-in string classes include methods for examining individual characters, comparing strings, searching strings, extracting
Strings are always defined inside either double quotes ("Abc") or single quotes ('ABC
root.related: string_formatting string_find string_strip string_join string_split string_replace
